children.title: Battery Mfr Date  (10.6.10.1.1)
children.hint: 10.6.10.1.1 Batteries shall be marked with the month and year of manufacture using the month/year format.  10.6.10.1.2 Where the battery is not marked with the month/year by the manufacturer, the installer shall obtain the datecode and mark the battery with the month/year of battery manufacture.

children.title: Visual Inspection  (Table 14.3.1(9))
children.hint: Table 14.3.1(9) Batteries Inspect for corrosion or leakage. Verify tightness of connections. Verify marking of the month/year of manufacture (all types).

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load Voltage Test #1  (Table 14.4.3.2(9(c)(4))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2 (9(c))(4) Load voltage test Verify the battery performs under load, in accordance with the battery manufacturer's specifications

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load Voltage Test #1 Value
children.hint: Note the value from load test #1

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load Voltage Test #2 Value
children.hint: Note the value from load test #2

children.title: Charger Test (Table 14.4.3.2(9(c)(2)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2 (9(c))((2) Charger test With the batteries fully charged and connected to the charger, measure the voltage across the batteries with a voltmeter. Verify the voltage is 2.30 volts per cell ±0.02 volts at 77°F (25°C) or as specified by the equipment manufacturer.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Charger Test Value
children.hint: Note the value from charger test

children.title: Discharge Test (Table 14.4.3.2(9(c)(3))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2 (9(c))(3) Discharge test With the battery charger disconnected, load test the batteries following the manufacturer’s recommendations. Verify the voltage level does not fall below the levels specified. Load testing can be by means of an artificial load equal to the full fire alarm load connected to the battery.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Discharge Test Value
children.hint: Note the value from charger test

children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(2) Illuminate lamps and LEDs

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Acknowledge/silence button functions properly. (23.8.2.9)
children.hint: 23.8.2.9 Protected premises fire alarm control units shall be capable of being reset or silenced only from the fire alarm control unit at the protected premises, unless otherwise permitted by 23.8.2.10.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Transmission of signals to off-premises location. (Table 14.4.3.2(3(d)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(3(d))  Actuate an initiating device and verify receipt of alarm signal at the off-premises location.  Create a trouble condition and verify receipt of a trouble signal at the off-premises location.  Actuate a supervisory device and verify receipt of a supervisory signal at the off-premises location.  If a transmission carrier is capable of operation under a single- or multiple-fault condition, actuate an initiating device during such fault condition and verify receipt of an alarm signal and a trouble signal at the off-premises location.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Ground fault monitoring circuit, if applicable,  operates properly. (Table 14.4.3.2(3(c)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(3(c)) If the system has a ground detection feature, verify the occurrence of ground-fault indication whenever any installation conductor is grounded.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Power supply supervison operating properly.  (Table  14.4.3.2(2(a)))
children.hint: Table  14.4.3.2(2(a))  Verify correct receipt of alarm, supervisory, and trouble signals (inputs); operation of evacuation signals and auxiliary functions (outputs)'; circuit supervision, including detection of open circuits and ground faults; and power supply supervision for detection of loss of ac power and disconnection of secondary batteries.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Correct fuses installed.  (Table 14.4.3.2(2(b)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(2(b))  Verify rating and supervision.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Disconnect switches, if applicable, operating properly.  (Table 14.4.3.2(3(b)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(3(b))  If control unit has a disconnect or isolating switches, verify performance of intended function of each switch.  Verify receipt of trouble signal when a supervised function is disconnected.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Secondary (standby) power supply.  (Table 14.4.3.2(2(e)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(2(e))  Disconnect all secondary (standby) power and test under maximum load, including all alarm appliances requireing simultaneous operation.  Reconnect all secondary (standby) power at end of test.  Test redundant power supplies separately.

children.hint: "10.14.8 Trouble signals and their restoration to normal shall be visibly and audibly indicated at the proprietary supervising station for systems installed in compliance with Chapter 26.  Actuate initiating device and verify receipt of the correct initiating device signal at the supervising station within 90 seconds. Upon completion of the test, restore the system to its functional operating condition"

children.title: Signal was received on primary phone line with secondary line disconnected
children.hint: Indicate if signal was received on primary line when secondary line disconnected.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Visual Inspection  Table 14.3.1(4(a))
children.hint: Table 14.3.1(4(a)) Verify location, physical condition, and a system normal condition.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Signal from initiating device received at supervising station.  (Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(b))  Except for DACTs installed prior to adoption of the 2013 edition of NFPA 72 that are connected to a telephone line (number) that is also supervised for adverse conditions by a derived local channel, ensure connection of the DACT to two separate means of transmission.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Line seizure test with receipt of signal at supervising station.  (Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)) Test DACT for line seizure capability by initiating a signal while using the telephone line (primary line for DACTs using two telephone lines) for a telephone call. Ensure that the call is interrupted and that the communicator connects to the digital alarm receiver. Verify receipt of the correct signal at the supervising station. Verify each transmission attempt is completed within 90 seconds from going off-hook to on-hook.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Primary line disconnect trouble signal receipt at supervising station.  (Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)) Disconnect the telephone line (primary line for DACTs using two telephone lines) from the DACT. Verify indication of the DACT trouble signal occurs at the premises fire alarm control unit within 4 minutes of detection of the fault. Verify receipt of the telephone line trouble signal at the supervising station. Restore the telephone line (primary line for DACTs using two telephone lines), reset the fire alarm control unit, and verify that the telephone line fault trouble signal returns to normal. Verify that the supervising station receives the restoral signal from the DACT.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Signal was received on primary phone line with secondary line disconnected  (Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)) Disconnect the secondary means of transmission from the DACT. Verify indication of the DACT trouble signal occurs at the premises fire alarm control unit within 4 minutes of detection of the fault. Verify receipt of the secondary means trouble signal at the supervising station. Restore the secondary means of transmission, reset the fire alarm control unit, and verify that the trouble signal returns to normal. Verify that the supervising station receives the restoral signal from the secondary transmitter.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Signal transmitted to DACR with fault in primary line.  (Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(b)) Cause the DACT to transmit a signal to the DACR while a fault in the telephone line (number) (primary line for DACTs using two telephone lines) is simulated. Verify utilization of the secondary communication path by the DACT to complete the transmission to the DACR.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Audible and visual annunciation of trouble signal.  (Table 14.4.3.2(27b))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2 27(b) Disconnect each transmission means in turn from the DACR, and verify audible and visual annunciation of a trouble signal in the supervising station. Cause a signal to be transmitted on each individual incoming DACR line (path) at least once every 6 hours (24 hours for DACTs installed prior to adoption of the 2013 edition of NFPA 72). Verify receipt of these signals.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Signal transmitted and receipt verified (Table 1.4.3.2(27b))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2 27(b) Disconnect each transmission means in turn from the DACR, and verify audible and visual annunciation of a trouble signal in the supervising station. Cause a signal to be transmitted on each individual incoming DACR line (path) at least once every 6 hours (24 hours for DACTs installed prior to adoption of the 2013 edition of NFPA 72). Verify receipt of these signals.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
AC power supervision (Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(27(c))  Cause the following conditions of all DARRs on all subsidiary and repeater station receiving equipment. Verify receipt at the supervising station of correct signals for each of the following conditions:  (1) AC power failure of the radio equipment

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Receiver malfunction supervision.  (Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)) Cause the following conditions of all DARRs on all subsidiary and repeater station receiving equipment. Verify receipt at the supervising station of correct signals for each of the following conditions: (2) Receiver malfunction

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Antenna and cable supervision.  (Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)) Cause the following conditions of all DARRs on all subsidiary and repeater station receiving equipment. Verify receipt at the supervising station of correct signals for each of the following conditions: (3) Antenna and interconnecting cable failure

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Automatic switchover supervision.  (Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)) Cause the following conditions of all DARRs on all subsidiary and repeater station receiving equipment. Verify receipt at the supervising station of correct signals for each of the following conditions: (4) Indication of automatic switchover of the DARR

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Receipt of transmission line failure signal at supervising station.  (Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(27(c)) Cause the following conditions of all DARRs on all subsidiary and repeater station receiving equipment. Verify receipt at the supervising station of correct signals for each of the following conditions: (5) Data transmission line failure between the DARR and the supervising or subsidiary station

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Trouble signal with primary line disconnected.  Table 14.4.3.2(4(c))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(c)) Disconnect the primary telephone line. Verify transmission of a trouble signal to the supervising station by the DART occurs within 4 minutes.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Visual Inspection
children.hint: Table 14.3.1(4(3))  Verify location, physical condition and a system normal condition.

children.title: Transmitter Operational Test
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(4(4))  Actuate initiating device. Verify production of not less than three complete rounds of not less than three signal impulses each by the McCulloh transmitter.  If end-to-end metallic continuity is present and with a balanced circuit, cause each of the following four transmission channel fault conditions in turn, and verify receipt of correct signals at the supervising station:   (1) Open  (2) Ground  (3) Wire-to-wire short  (4) Open and ground   If end-to-end metallic continuity is not present and with a properly balanced circuit, cause each of the following three transmission channel fault conditions in turn, and verify receipt of correct signals at the supervising station:   (1) Open  (2) Ground  (3) Wire-to-wire short

children.title: Transmission Channel Fault

children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2(3(d))  Actuate an initiating device and verify receipt of alarm signal at the off-premises location. Visual Inspection  (Table 14.3.1(9))
children.hint: Table 14.3.1(9) Batteries Inspect for corrosion or leakage. Verify tightness of connections. Verify marking of the month/year of manufacture (all types).

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Load Voltage Test  (Table 14.4.3.2(9(c)(4))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2 (9(c))(4) Load voltage test Verify the battery performs under load, in accordance with the battery manufacturer's specifications

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Charger Test (Table 14.4.3.2(9(c)(2)))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2 (9(c))((2) Charger test With the batteries fully charged and connected to the charger, measure the voltage across the batteries with a voltmeter. Verify the voltage is 2.30 volts per cell ±0.02 volts at 77°F (25°C) or as specified by the equipment manufacturer.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Discharge Test (Table 14.4.3.2(9(c)(3))
children.hint: Table 14.4.3.2 (9(c))(3) Discharge test With the battery charger disconnected, load test the batteries following the manufacturer’s recommendations. Verify the voltage level does not fall below the levels specified. Load testing can be by means of an artificial load equal to the full fire alarm load connected to the battery.

Liability Release Statement
children.calculate_expr: "The owner and/or designated representative acknowledges the responsibility of the operating condition of the component parts at the time of this inspection. It is agreed that the inspection service provided by the contractor as prescribed herein is limited to performing a visual inspection and/or routine testing, and any investigation or unscheduled testing, modification, maintenance, repair, etc., of the component parts is not included as part of the inspection work performed. It is further understood that all information contained herein is provided to the best of the knowledge of the party providing such information."
